aws::graph::propositions: # Aviation Accident Report for Frankenmuth, Michigan
The accident occurred in Frankenmuth, Michigan.
The accident occurred on August 10, 2013.
The accident occurred at 14:00 Local time.
The aircraft involved was a KERR MATTHEW STARDUSTER TOO.
The aircraft registration was N159MK.
The defining event was a runway excursion.
The flight was conducted under Part 91: General aviation - Personal.
The accident number was CEN13CA479.
The aircraft sustained substantial damage.
The accident resulted in 1 minor injury.
The pilot reported that wind was prevailing from the left during landing.
The runway was narrow.
During the landing roll, the pilot attempted to maneuver the airplane to correct for the wind.
The airplane veered to the right during the landing roll.
The airplane exited the runway.
The airplane continued into a corn field.
The airplane came to rest upright.
The airplane sustained substantial damage to the right wing spar.
A Federal Aviation Administration Inspector examined the airplane.
The Federal Aviation Administration Inspector found no evidence of preaccident mechanical malfunctions.
The Federal Aviation Administration Inspector found no failures that would have precluded normal operation.
The National Transportation Safety Board determined the probable cause of the accident to be the pilot's loss of directional control during the landing roll.
The loss of directional control resulted in a runway excursion.
The runway excursion resulted in subsequent impact with a corn field.
The National Transportation Safety Board finding was that directional control was not attained/maintained.

text:
# Aviation Investigation Final Report

## Location:
Frankenmuth, Michigan

## Date & Time: 
August 10, 2013, 14:00 Local

## Aircraft:
KERR MATTHEW STARDUSTER TOO

## Defining Event:
Runway excursion

## Flight Conducted Under:
Part 91: General aviation - Personal

## Accident Number:
CEN13CA479

## Registration:
N159MK

## Aircraft Damage:
Substantial

## Injuries:
1 Minor

## Analysis

In a statement provided to the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), the pilot reported that while landing on the narrow runway the wind was prevailing from the left. During the landing roll, the pilot attempted to maneuver the airplane and correct for the wind, but the airplane veered to the right and exited the runway. The airplane continued to the right into a corn field, came to rest upright, and sustained substantial damage to the right wing spar. An FAA Inspector examined the airplane and found no evidence of preaccident mechanical malfunctions or failures that would have precluded normal operation.

## Probable Cause and Findings

The National Transportation Safety Board determines the probable cause(s) of this accident to be:

The pilot's loss of directional control during the landing roll, which resulted in a runway excursion and subsequent impact with a corn field.

## Findings

| Aircraft | Directional control - Not attained/maintained |
| --- | --- |

---
